children.name: make progress when you are trying to do sth
make progress b1
children.definition: make progress if you make progress, you gradually start to achieve what you want:tiến bộ, tiến triển
examples: far too many people are still unemployed, but we are making progress.
make progress in/on :tiến bộ trong
at yalta, russia and ukraine made progress in several aspects of their bilateral relations
rapid progress has been made on the development of drugs for the treatment of aids .
make progress towards british /toward american
the talks were aimed at making progress towards greater european union.

children.name: progress b2
children.definition: progress to improve, develop, or achieve things so that you are then at a more advanced stageopp regress:tiến bộ, tiến triển
examples: i asked the nurse how my son was progressing.
progress to
she started with a cleaning job, and progressed to running the company.
progress towards
we must progress towards full integration of catholic and protestant pupils in ireland.
progress beyond
last year the team didn’t progress beyond the opening round.
progress well/quickly/successfully etc
work on the ship progressed quickly.
bob was a very good football coach, and the team progressed very well.
progress according to plan
so far the building work has progressed according to plan.

children.name: go well b1
children.definition: go if a particular activity or piece of workgoeswell, fine etc, it happens in a way that is good, so that you can gradually achieve what you want:diễn ra
examples: go well/fine/better etc
fiona says that her new teaching job is going really well.
things went better after the new computer system was installed.
how’s something going?
‘how are your exams going, luke?’ ‘fine, thanks.’
the waysth’sgoing
i feel very happy about the way the project’s going so far.

children.name: be getting there b2
children.definition: be getting there informal if youare getting there,you are starting to achieve what you want, after difficulties or problems that have made progress slow:
examples: the company had a lot of problems initially, but they’re getting there now.
it’s been a struggle paying off all our debts, but i think at last we’re getting there.

children.name: advance x
children.definition: advance ifsth, especially scientific and technical knowledge, advances, it develops and improves:tiến bộ
examples: computer technology is advancing very rapidly.
our knowledge of the deepest parts of the ocean has advanced considerably over the last ten years.
our understanding of human genetics has advanced considerably.

children.name: make headway x
children.definition: make headway to make progress towards achieving something – used especially when it is difficult to make progress: tiến triển, tiến bộ
examples: sylvia’s teachers all say that she has made great headway this term.
the new agreement indicated that the government was at last making headway against the terrorists.
make headway in
if either side is to make any headway in these negotiations, they must be prepared to compromise.

children.name: move x
children.definition: move if an event or activity moves quickly, slowly or in the right direction, it progresses in that way:“dịch chuyển”
examples: things moved quickly once we had agreed a price on the house.
i think that the trade agreement is moving in the right direction.
police say that the investigation is moving slowly, and they are hoping that more witnesses will come forward.

children.name: come along c2
children.definition: come along/come onuk c2 ifsthsuch as a piece of work comes along, it progresses in a very satisfactory way: tiến triển, tiến bộ
examples: mary’s reading and writing has really started to come along recently.
come along well/fine/better etc
the work on the new school sports centre is coming on very well.
how’ssthcoming along?
‘how’s your project coming along?’ ‘oh, fine, thanks.’

children.name: make great strides x
children.definition: make great strides  if peoplemake great strides, they make progress very rapidly towards improving knowledge or methods, especially in scientific, technical, or educational areas:tạo bước tiến lớn
examples: ▪ science has made great strides since the 1970s.
make great strides in
▪ great strides have been made in reducing air pollution in us cities.
▪ the conference highlighted the great strides made in education in third world countries.
make great strides towardsuk/towardus
▪we have made great strides towards equality between the sexes in legal status and rights.

children.name: forge ahead x
children.definition: forge ahead to make progress very quickly towards achievingsth, especially faster than other people: tiến lên phía trước
examples: our export sales have continued to forge ahead this year.
forge ahead in
growing environmental fears have made climate research all the more important, and europe is forging ahead in this field.
forge ahead with
the prime minister promised that the government would forge ahead with the reforms.

children.name: in leaps and bounds c2
children.definition: come on in leaps and boundsuk/improve/develop etc by leaps and boundsus if a person or the study, development etc ofsthcomes on in leaps and bounds, they make progress very quickly, especially in knowledge or ability:vượt bậc, nhảy vọt
examples: jake was slow to learn to read, but now he’s coming on in leaps and bounds.
we were very surprised to see the way this field of philosophical thought has grown by leaps and bounds.

children.name: to make no progress at all
make no progress b1
children.definition: make no progress to not progress at all with a piece of work or activity: không tiến triển
examples: ▪ the lawyers are trying to reach an agreement but so far no progress has been made.
make no progress on/ in/ with
▪ because of bad weather we made no progress on the house for the next three days.
▪ police were making no progress in their efforts to trace a man seen near the scene of the murder.
▪ the city council have made no progress with their plans to rebuild the town hall.

children.name: get nowhere c2
children.definition: get nowhereinformalto not progress at all, even though you have worked hard : chẳng đi đến đâu
examples: ▪i feel as though i’m getting nowhere in this job.
▪not surprisingly, the peace talks got nowhere.
get nowhere with
▪don started to learn arabic, but he was getting nowhere with it.
get nowhere fast
▪the project was eating up time and money and seemed to be getting nowhere fast.

children.name: go around in circles x
children.definition: go around in circles/go round in circlesuk to keep discussing the same problems without making any decisions or finding any answers:luẩn quẩn
examples: this conversation’s going around in circles again.
every time we try to reach a decision, we end up going round in circles.

children.name: stagnate x
children.definition: stagnate to stop developing or improving and often become worse :tù đọng, đình trệ,
examples: business here has stagnated compared with other wine-producing regions.
everyone needs new challenges. otherwise you just stagnate.

children.name: grind to a halt x
children.definition: grind to a haltto slowly stop making any progress :the economy seems to be grinding to a halt.|it was clear that the peace talks had ground to a halt.

children.name: success when you are trying to achieve sth
progress b1
children.definition: progress the process of getting better at doingsth, or getting closer to finishing or achievingsth :sự tiến bộ, tiến triển
examples: progress of
the police are disappointed by the slow progress of the investigation.
progress in
there has been significant progress in controlling heart disease.
progress towards
we are making steady progress towards a peaceful settlement.
progress on
little progress has been made on human rights issues.
make progressthe country has made significant economic progress.
hinder sb’s progress(= make it slower )language problems might hinder a child’s progress at school.
achieve progressthe talks ended with no real progress having been achieved.
check (on) sb’s progressa social worker calls regularly to check on the children’s progress.
follow/monitor/chart sb’s progress(= keep checking it )throughout the night, doctors charted his progress.
assess/evaluate/review sb’s progresswe appraise the work and evaluate each student’s individual progress.
slowthe task remains difficult and progress has been slow.
steadysteady progress has been made towards our objectives.
goodhe is out of hospital and making good progress.
rapidthe investigation is making rapid progress.
significant/real progresssignificant progress has been made in reducing nuclear weapons.
great progressscientists have made great progress in the last four years.
substantial/considerable progress2007 was a year of substantial progress for the company.
satisfactory progressthe two students who fell behind are now making satisfactory progress.
economic/political/social etc progressspencer insisted that free enterprise was the key to social progress.

children.name: advance b2
children.definition: advance a discovery, invention, or change that brings progress :sự tiến bộ
examples: the technological advances of the twentieth century
technological/scientific/medical etc advance
one of the great technological advances of the 20th century
in recent years there have been enormous economic and social advances.
amajor advance
advance in
recent advances in genetics have raised moral questions.
advance on
an advance on previous treatments
theadvances madein the understanding of mental handicap

children.name: process b2
children.definition: process
examples: 1a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result :
the israeli–egyptianpeace process
repetition can help the learning process.
process of
the process of economic change
slow/lengthy/laborious etc process
getting fit again has been a long slow process.
themental processesinvolved in decision-making
2a series of things that happen naturally and result in gradual change
process of
thenatural processof evolution
coal forms by aslow processof chemical change.
the digestive process
slowcollecting the data is a slow process.
long/lengthytry to be patient through the long process of healing.
laborious(= taking a lot of time and effort )the copying of manuscripts was a laborious process.
complexgetting a visa can be a complex process.
a natural processbirth is a natural process.
a formal processa decision will only be taken after a formal consultation process.
a mental processcats have different mental processes from dogs.
the learning processthe student is actively involved in the learning process.
the peace processthey are frustrated with the lack of progress in the peace process.
the decision-making processnot all staff can participate in the decision-making process.
a selection processan interview normally forms part of the selection process.
go through a process(alsoundergo a processformal) (= experience a process )a lot of companies are going through a process of change.|the system underwent a process of simplification.
take part in a process(alsoparticipate in a process)we encourage our clients to participate in the process at every stage.

children.name: rebuild b2
children.definition: rebuildverbrebuilt,rebuilt
examples: if you rebuild a system or organization, you develop it so that it works effectively
_before the election, the party claimed it would rebuild the country's economy.

children.name: forward c1
children.definition: forwardadverb(alsoforwards)progress
examples: used in expressions related to progress_this is a bigstepforward for democracy.

children.name: ahead c2
children.definition: aheadadverbin front
examples: making more progress than someone else
_sophie isway(= far) ahead of the other children in her class.

children.name: flourish c2
children.definition: flourishverbsucceed
examples: [ i ] to grow or develop successfully
_my tomatoes are flourishing this summer - it must be the warm weather.
_watercolour painting began to flourish inbritainaround 1750.

children.name: further c2
children.definition: furtherverb
examples: to develop or make progres in something
_he has probably done more to furtherthe causeof interracial harmony than any other person.
_additional training is probably the best way to further your career these days.

children.name: track c2
children.definition: tracknoundevelopment
examples: [ c or u ] the direction in which someone's job or education develops
_she was a lawyer, but then she changed track completely and became a doctor.

children.name: unfold c2
children.definition: unfoldverbdevelop
examples: [ i ] if a situation or story unfolds, it develops or becomes clear to other people
_like a lot of people, i've watched theeventsof the last few days unfold on tv.
_as the plot unfolds, you gradually realise that all your initial assumptions were wrong.
